{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = Linksys WPC600N 1.1 001.jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = Dual-Band Wireless-N Notebook Adapter |caption2 = |pp = |sp = http://support.linksys.com/us/support-product?pid=01t80000003KSj5AAG |dl = |fandom = Linksys_WPC600N_v1.1 |wikidevi = Linksys_WPC600N |wikipedia = |brand = Linksys |model = WPC600N |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = v1.1 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 09/07/2010 |page_start_origon = https://infodepot.fandom.com/wiki/Linksys_WPC600N_v1.1 |sernum = |wlclass = AN600 |series = |if = PCMCIA (32-bit) |if_bus_version = |ifconnector = |formfactor = |vendor_id = 14e4 |device_id = 4328 |subvendor_id = 1737 |subdevice_id = 0066 |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = Q87-WPC600NV11 |icid = 3839A-WPC6NV11 |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 00:1E:E5, 00:21:29, 00:22:6B, 00:23:69 |chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4321; |chip2 = Broadcom;BCM2055;BCM2055KFBG, HS0522 P20, N1; |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = Gemtek |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = 2.4/5GHz Front End Module;Skyworks;unknown;;1; |flags = DFS, |802dot11_protocols = abgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 07/31/2007 |estreldate = |price = |upc = 745883573172 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B000WMK8TE |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = Taiwan |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== WPC600N serial numbers appear to start with '''ANV0''' or '''MNV0'''. :{{WiFiCert|WFA5421|03/31/2008}} ===lspci -nnv dump=== 
Network controller: Broadcom BCM4321 802.11a/b/g/n [14e4:4328] (rev 01)
Subsystem: Linksys WPC600N v1 802.11a/b/g/n Wireless-N Adapter [1737:0066]
        Flags: bus master, fast devsel, latency 64, IRQ 19
        Memory at f1d00000 (32-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=16K]
        Kernel driver in use: b43-pci-bridge
===ssb + b43 dump=== 
ssb: Found chip with id 0x4321, rev 0x01 and package 0x01
ssb: Core 0 found: ChipCommon (cc 0x800, rev 0x12, vendor 0x4243)
ssb: Core 1 found: IEEE 802.11 (cc 0x812, rev 0x0B, vendor 0x4243)
ssb: Core 2 found: PCI-E (cc 0x820, rev 0x02, vendor 0x4243)
ssb: Core 3 found: PCI (cc 0x804, rev 0x0D, vendor 0x4243)
ssb: Core 4 found: USB 1.1 Host (cc 0x817, rev 0x04, vendor 0x4243)
ssb: Sonics Silicon Backplane found on PCI device 0000:06:00.0
b43-phy5: Broadcom 4321 WLAN found (core revision 11)
b43-phy5: Found PHY: Analog 5, Type 4 (N), Revision 1
          Broadcom 43xx driver loaded [ Features: PNL ]
ieee80211 phy5: Selected rate control algorithm 'minstrel_ht'
b43-phy5: Loading firmware version 666.2 (2011-02-23 01:15:07)
b43-phy5 ERROR: Fatal DMA error: 0x00000400, 0x00000000, 0x00000000
b43-phy5 ERROR: This device does not support DMA on your system.
         It will now be switched to PIO.
b43-phy5: Controller RESET (DMA error) ...
b43-phy5: Loading firmware version 666.2 (2011-02-23 01:15:07)
b43-phy5 warning: Forced PIO by use_pio module parameter.
         This should not be needed and will result in lower performance.
b43-phy5: Controller restarted
IPv6: ADDRCONF(NETDEV_UP): wlan147: link is not ready
